    Data Summaries

    Kyle Baron

    2020-07-27

    data-summaries.Rmd

    This vignette shows how to expose the different data summary functions.

    library(pmtables)
data <- pmtables:::data("id")
obs <- pmtables:::data("obs")

    Continuous

    Long

    cont_table_data(
 data, 
 by = "STUDYf",
 cols = c("WT", "ALB", "SCR"), 
 digits = new_digits(.default = 3)
)
. # A tibble: 12 x 7
.    outer       name      n Mean  Median SD    `Min / Max` 
.    <fct>       <fct> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>       
.  1 12-DEMO-001 WT       29 72.2  70.0   14.3  50.9 / 97.2 
.  2 12-DEMO-001 ALB      29 4.28  4.08   0.474 3.56 / 5.15 
.  3 12-DEMO-001 SCR      30 1.03  1.04   0.155 0.740 / 1.30
.  4 12-DEMO-002 WT       49 72.4  72.1   11.5  51.5 / 96.6 
.  5 12-DEMO-002 ALB      50 4.47  4.43   0.468 3.65 / 5.39 
.  6 12-DEMO-002 SCR      50 0.971 0.970  0.161 0.720 / 1.30
.  7 11-DEMO-005 WT       39 68.9  65.4   14.5  43.6 / 92.8 
.  8 11-DEMO-005 ALB      39 4.41  4.44   0.537 3.51 / 5.39 
.  9 11-DEMO-005 SCR      40 2.52  2.33   1.43  0.720 / 5.59
. 10 13-DEMO-001 WT       40 69.4  68.1   11.6  50.7 / 96.6 
. 11 13-DEMO-001 ALB      38 3.58  3.65   1.15  1.28 / 5.38 
. 12 13-DEMO-001 SCR      40 0.950 0.975  0.165 0.710 / 1.26

    Wide

    cont_table_data(
 data, 
 panel = "STUDYf",
 cols = c("WT", "ALB", "SCR"), 
 digits = new_digits(.default = 3), 
 fun = pt_opts$cont.wide.fun,
 wide = TRUE
)
. # A tibble: 4 x 5
.   STUDYf      outer WT               ALB               SCR               
.   <fct>       <chr> <chr>            <chr>             <chr>             
. 1 12-DEMO-001 all   72.2 (14.3) [29] 4.28 (0.474) [29] 1.03 (0.155) [30] 
. 2 12-DEMO-002 all   72.4 (11.5) [49] 4.47 (0.468) [50] 0.971 (0.161) [50]
. 3 11-DEMO-005 all   68.9 (14.5) [39] 4.41 (0.537) [39] 2.52 (1.43) [40]  
. 4 13-DEMO-001 all   69.4 (11.6) [40] 3.58 (1.15) [38]  0.950 (0.165) [40]

    Categorical

    Long

    cat_data(
  data, 
  cols = c("SEXf", "FORMf"), 
  by = "RFf"
)
. # A tibble: 5 x 6
.   name  level   normal     mild     moderate severe  
.   <chr> <chr>   <chr>      <chr>    <chr>    <chr>   
. 1 SEXf  male    58 (44.6)  7 (70.0) 8 (80.0) 7 (70.0)
. 2 SEXf  female  72 (55.4)  3 (30.0) 2 (20.0) 3 (30.0)
. 3 FORMf tablet  109 (83.8) 7 (70.0) 6 (60.0) 8 (80.0)
. 4 FORMf capsule 12 (9.2)   2 (20.0) 0 (0.0)  1 (10.0)
. 5 FORMf troche  9 (6.9)    1 (10.0) 4 (40.0) 1 (10.0)

    Wide

    cat_data(
  data, 
  cols = c("SEXf", "FORMf"), 
  by = "RFf", 
  wide = TRUE
)
. # A tibble: 4 x 6
.   RFf      SEXf.male SEXf.female FORMf.tablet FORMf.capsule FORMf.troche
.   <fct>    <chr>     <chr>       <chr>        <chr>         <chr>       
. 1 normal   58 (44.6) 72 (55.4)   109 (83.8)   12 (9.2)      9 (6.9)     
. 2 mild     7 (70.0)  3 (30.0)    7 (70.0)     2 (20.0)      1 (10.0)    
. 3 moderate 8 (80.0)  2 (20.0)    6 (60.0)     0 (0.0)       4 (40.0)    
. 4 severe   7 (70.0)  3 (30.0)    8 (80.0)     1 (10.0)      1 (10.0)

    Data inventory

    Unstacked

    data_inventory_data(
  obs, 
  by = "STUDYf"
)
. # A tibble: 5 x 10
.   STUDYf       SUBJ NMISS  NOBS  NBQL POBS  PBQL  OOBS  OBQL  .total
.   <chr>       <int> <int> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> 
. 1 12-DEMO-001    30     8   427    15 100.0 3.5   12.6  0.4   <NA>  
. 2 12-DEMO-002    50    10  1152    38 100.0 3.3   34.0  1.1   <NA>  
. 3 11-DEMO-005    40    19  1071    30 100.0 2.8   31.6  0.9   <NA>  
. 4 13-DEMO-001    40    13   736    11 100.0 1.5   21.7  0.3   <NA>  
. 5 .total        160    50  3386    94 ---   ---   100.0 2.8   all

    Stacked

    pmtables:::data_inventory_data_split(
  data,
  by = "STUDYf", 
  panel = "SEQf",
  stacked = FALSE
)
. # A tibble: 5 x 10
.   STUDYf      SEQf   SUBJ NMISS  NOBS  NBQL POBS  PBQL  OOBS  OBQL 
.   <chr>       <chr> <int> <int> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>
. 1 12-DEMO-001 Dose     30     0    29     1 19.5  0.7   19.5  0.7  
. 2 12-DEMO-002 Dose     50     0    47     3 31.5  2.0   31.5  2.0  
. 3 11-DEMO-005 Dose     40     0    36     4 24.2  2.7   24.2  2.7  
. 4 13-DEMO-001 Dose     40     1    37     2 24.8  1.3   24.8  1.3  
. 5 .total      Dose    160     1   149    10 ---   ---   100.0 6.7
